post_text:
We can all be heroes! Protect yourself and the people you love. Wear a mask, Wash your hands, Watch your distance (stay at least six feet away from others when you go out.)

Ms. Jenson from the FDR Library designed this Red Riding Hood poster. What kind of poster would you make to encourage everyone to wear a mask? Share your great ideas! #LESDmaskchallenge

Don't forget to follow our Elementary School Library Program @lesd.readers and our Middle School Library Media Center @lesd.lmc

Has your family been affected during the COVID-19 pandemic? We can connect you with resources to provide you support during these times.

You are welcome to contact Claudia_Godoy@lawndalesd.net or call (310) 973-1300 if you have any questions about Medi-cal, Calfresh, P-EBT and many other resources we have available for our community.

Â¿Ha sido afectada su familia durante la pandemia de COVID-19? Podemos conectarlo con los recursos para brindarle apoyo durante estos tiempos.

Did you know that technical support is just one click away? We are here to help if you are having trouble with your Chromebook, encountering internet connection problems, or need support figuring anything tech-related.

Simply visit www.lawndalesd.net and click on the "Tech Support" icon and someone from our technology team will be in touch with you!

post_text: Please watch this video for a report from Dr. Hamilton, LESD Superintendent, on distance learning and support for parents. You will soon be receiving a parent handbook with the final plans for distance learning. The schedules in the videos are subject to changes due to negotiations with labor unions. The middle school schedule for asynchronous learning has changed from Friday to Monday. The first day of school is Wednesday, August 26 and we look forward to seeing you then!

post_text:
Please share with any families in Lawndale and surrounding cities that are looking for a free, high-quality preschool and day care!

Do you have a student that is ready for preschool? Lawndale State Preschool is now accepting application for the new school year!

Our main office is located at the Kit Carson campus at 3530 W 147th St., Hawthorne, CA 90250. Please call the main office at (310) 644-8458 to get more information. We are open Tuesdays & and Wednesdays from 9 am-3 pm.

Visit the State Preschool website for more information. We look forward to serving your student!

http://carson.lawndalesd.net/prek

Creamy Banana Smoothie by @lesdnutrition ğŸŒ

Looking for a chilly and creamy treat? All you need is a ripe banana, milk and some ice. To make it extra yummy, add a tablespoon of peanut butter or raw oats.

- 1 ripe banana from your school meal kit

- 1 cup low fat or fat free milk from your school meal kit

- 1/2 cup ice

1. Put all the ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth and enjoy!

post_text: In accordance with revised Public Health directives, LA County Library will resume offering holds placement and no-contact holds pickup at select locations. Due dates are extended to July 15, and all book drops are open for returns. Please visit LACountyLibrary.org/express-service for complete details.

Did your baby carrots start turning into mummies? Use this trick from @lesdnutrition to bring them back.

Put the baby carrots in a bowl, and fill with water until theyâ€™re completely covered.

Add a squeeze of lemon or lime juice.

Put the bowl in the refrigerator for 2-3 hours.

Drain them and theyâ€™re ready to eat or use in a recipe.

Los Angeles World Airports' Aviation Careers Academy is a week-long motivational program designed to provide students with the basic understanding of career opportunities within the aviation industry, as well as general knowledge about Los Angeles International Airport (LAX). The program is open to all Los Angeles area middle school and high school students in communities surrounding LAX.

APPLY TODAY, DEADLINE HAS BEEN EXTENDED UNTIL 6/21!

https://www.lawa.org/ace

Need to beat the heat? Check out this yummy treat suggestion from @lesdnutrition

Put strawberry yogurt (or 100% fruit juice) in a small paper cup, plastic cup, popsicle mold or ice tray.

Put a popsicle stick or toothpick in it.

Freeze for at least two hours.

Has your family been affected during the COVID-19 pandemic? We can connect you with resources to provide you support during these times.

You are welcome to contact Claudia_Godoy@lawndalesd.net or call (310) 973-1300 if you have any questions about Medi-cal, Calfresh, P-EBT and many other resources we have available for our community.

Â¿Ha sido afectada su familia durante la pandemia de COVID-19? Podemos conectarlo con los recursos para brindarle apoyo durante estos tiempos.

post_text:
P-EBT is here to help you buy food while schools are closed. Get up to $365 per child to spend on groceries. Per the California Department of Education, all students that attend a Provision 2 school are eligible to apply. All LESD schools are Provision 2.

Regardless of your immigration status, you can apply through June 30 at https://ca.p-ebt.org/

You may also contact claudia_godoy@lawndalesd.net if you have any questions.

A look back at the collaboration and achievements of parents and the district working together. Thank you for your dedicated work for all students.

Please join this town hall hosted by CNN. The 60-minute special "Coming Together: Standing Up to Racism. A CNN/Sesame Street Town Hall for Kids and Families" will air on Saturday, June 6, at 10 a.m. ET.

How to watch: The town hall will air on CNN, CNN International and CNN en EspaÃ±ol. It will stream live on CNN.com's homepage and across mobile devices via CNN's apps, without requiring a cable log-in.

You can also watch on CNNgo, and subscribers to cable/satellite systems can watch it on-demand.

Parents can send in their questions, along with their full names and phone numbers.

https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/02/us/cnn-sesame-street-standing-up-to-racism/index.html?fbclid=IwAR3nga-vIsWIvehXle9I4pxX3Xaiy-_r6jfLrY-1s2-1XYU3RLw0OQXoyWs

Today we celebrate the arts with the premiere of the 2020 TakePART virtual visual arts galleries. Every year we celebrate this festival to showcase the some of the best samples of our own student work along with our partner districts. Since this year we cannot celebrate in person, we can celebrate virtually! Enjoy this video showcasing work from our very own LESD students!

To see all of the virtual galleries, visit http://www.lawndalesd.net/takepart

A huge THANK YOU to Ms. HÃ©lÃ¨ne Trudeau, South Bay Regional Arts Coordinator, for helping this event come to life!

May 29 at 7:09 PM Â·

Chalk Walk organizer and art teacher Anne Marie Dâ€™Agostino, said she had no idea in March that she would be â€œdigitizing my art room,â€ but adapting to the pandemic has had an upside. Students competed over the last 10 days to create colorful chalk paintings on the sidewalk in front of their homes for the 14th annual CHALK WALK school spirit competition. A few Students who lived in close proximity gathered to do their chalk painting together for a hands-on art experience being apart together. ğŸ¨ La organizadora de Paseo de tiza y profesora de arte, Anne Marie D'Agostino, dijo que no teniÌa idea en marzo de que estariÌa "digitalizando mi sala de arte", pero adaptarse a la pandemia ha tenido un lado positivo. Los estudiantes compitieron en los uÌltimos 10 diÌas para crear artes de tiza en la acera frente a sus hogares para la 14ta competencia anual de espiÌritu escolar. Unos pocos estudiantes que viviÌan en las proximidades se reunieron para pintar con tiza ğŸ¨

P-EBT, is for students who are normally able to get free or reduced price school meals. Apply and get up to $365 per child to spend on groceries.

You can apply beginning this Friday May 22 at https://ca.p-ebt.org/ until June 30.

If you receive this card automatically in the mail, please do not discard it and please read our frequently asked questions about this resource below.

You may also contact claudia_godoy@lawndalesd.net if you have any questions.

Please attend a virtual workshop with Dr. Morgan Appel, Assistant Dean of Education and Community Outreach from UC San Diego Extension. He will be discussing the socioemotional needs of GATE students. Dr. Appel has presented to a variety of parents in districts throughout Southern California.

Date: May 14, 2020
Time: 4-5 pm

Please contact joy_wells@lawndalesd.net to get details on how you can participate in this meeting via Zoom.

Parents who attended the California Association for the Gifted conference will also have an opportunity to share knowledge with other parents in attendance. #buildingbrighterfutures #lawndale #gate

May 4th launches #NationalTeacherAppreciationWeek. Teachers across the nation and around the world have met the great challenge of distance learning with hard work, long hours and a collaborative and creative spirit! We are so proud of our teachers for ensuring that our students' learning continues, despite school closures. You are our #superheros and today we honor your commitment to providing students with an excellent education. Thank you for everything you do!

We are very fortunate to have the MOST outstanding After School Program in the country! @raplesd

Please share your appreciation with your school's RAP staff, and with our Director, Dennis Howard, and Assistant Director, Maggie Guillen.

The Realizing Amazing Potential Before and Afterschool program is celebrating Afterschool Professionals Appreciation Week on April 20-24, 2020, to recognize, appreciate and advocate for those who work with young people during out-of-school hours. Every day, 75 members of the RAP Before and After-school staff help our students Realize their Amazing Potential and invest their time and talents into the most valuable treasure that we have, our children.

Weâ€¦

Our top priority is the safety and health of our staff and our community. We are implementing a social distancing protocol for all individuals that visit our schools and district facilities. In addition, individuals experiencing symptoms of respiratory illness, fever, or cough are not permitted to enter district buildings or campuses. We're all in this together, so let's do our best to keep each other safe and healthy.

Nuestra principal prioridad es la seguridad y la salud de nuestro personal y nuestra comunidad. Estamos implementando un protocolo de distanciamiento social para todas las personas que visitan nuestras escuelas e instalaciones del distrito. AdemÃ¡s, las personas que experimentan sÃ­ntomas de enfermedad respiratoria, fiebre o tos no pueden ingresar a los edificios o campus del distrito. Todos estamos juntos en esto, asÃ­ que hagamos nuestro mejor esfuerzo para mantenernos seguros y saludables.

post_text: Some great tips and resources from our Student Support Services team to help you through these times. They are here to help, find out more at www.lawndalesd.net/sss
shared_text:
LESD Student Support Services is at Lawndale Elementary School District.
April 8 at 7:31 PM Â· Lawndale, CA Â·

With the uncertainties surrounding COVID-19 and the challenges of managing such significant changes to our daily lives in such a short period of time, it is normal to feel a loss of control, fear for safety, and heightened anxiety. LESD Student Support Services is here to help, and we remain available with information, resources, and services to address the mental health concerns and enhance the wellbeing of our students and families. #lesdsss #schoolmentalhealth #lesdsocialworkersrock @ Lawndale Elementary School District
